description.narrative: Output 1 [Nutrition Institutional Framework] : By 2019, the institutional and strategic repositioning of the nutrition sector has taken effect and facilitates integration across sectors, and the improvement of the sector's funding framework, which contributes to Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Health Systems Strengthening, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Women and children's nutrition]: By the end of 2019, the nutritional status of children aged 0-59 months and women of childbearing age has improved, especially those living in areas with high prevalence of malnutrition, particularly Mopti and Sikasso.

description.narrative: Discontinued. No activity has been undertaken on this output in 2018. This output has not been active since end 2017 and will be disactivated as soon as the Open Items related to supply are closed, and orders delivered and paid. | Status:Discontinued | As-of Date:18/07/2018
